business.headline: What is PM-Vidyalakshmi Scheme: Check all key details The PM-Vidyalakshmi scheme offers financial support to students pursuing higher education in India, ensuring that deserving students have access to the education they need without financial barriers.

Will the positive momentum last?Swiggy share price: As the stock reaches new highs, analysts are raising concerns about whether this positive momentum will last. The sharp rally has prompted some to question the stock's sustainability at these elevated levels.
CRR cut in focus at RBI MPC meet: What it means for the economyThe CRR is the percentage of a bank's total deposits that must be maintained as reserves with the RBI. At present, it is set at 4.5%.

World Bank's $188 million loan nod for Maharashtra to develop backward districtsThe World Bank has approved a $188.28-million loan to stimulate economic growth in the Indian state of Maharashtra, especially in the lagging districts, a media release said.

Bitcoin hits all-time high of $100,000 after Donald Trump's crypto pushThe jump in Bitcoin's value comes amid growing optimism among investors about a more crypto-friendly regulatory environment under the incoming administration of Donald Trump, who recently won the US Presidential elections.

ICICI's 3 offices searched by GST officials, bank says cooperating fullyICICI Bank said it was cooperating fully with the Maharashtra GST authorities after they searched the bank's three offices on Wednesday.
Allen Institute eyes $800 million Unacademy takeover: ReportThe proposed acquisition comes amid Unacademy's struggles to maintain its earlier valuation of $3.4 billion from 2021.

IndiGo on being rated among world's worst airlines: Doubt survey's credibilityIndiGo was ranked 103rd among 109 global airlines in a survey by a European Union claims processing agency. The air carrier refuted the report and questioned its credibility.

These 5 banks revise FD rates ahead of RBI's rate decisionSeveral banks, including Karnataka Bank, Canara Bank, and YES Bank, have revised their FD rates ahead of the Reserve Bank of India's rate decision on December 6.
Sensex, Nifty end higher as banking stocks rally on RBI rate cut hopesThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 110.58 points to close at 80,956.33, while the NSE Nifty50 added 10.30 points to end at 24,467.45.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Devendra Fadnavis oath today, Sena sets big condition linked to Eknath Shinde Live UpdatesMaharashtra CM Oath: This will be Devendra Fadnavis's third stint as Chief Minister of Maharashtra. He served in the top post from October 2014 to November 2019. His second stint, however, lasted only five days, from November 23 to 28, 2019, as the Shiv Sena walked out of an alliance with the BJP.

Rahul Gandhi is George Soros, two bodies but one soul: BJP's jab over Adani caseBJP leader Sambit Patra lashed out at Congress leader Rahul Gandhi and accused him of joining hands with foreign forces, including George Soros, to destabilise the country.

Rohit Sharma explains big sacrifice, says no time for dressing room rumours Ind vs Aus, 2nd Test: Captain Rohit Sharma explained his decision to move to the middle order, allowing KL Rahul and Yashasvi Jaiswal to continue opening the batting. Rohit also issued a firm warning to Australia ahead of the pink-ball Test.

Still Deputy CM, but Ajit Pawar outplayed sulking Shinde. This is howAs the Mahayuti trio take oath on Wednesday, NCP leader Ajit Pawar remains a deputy chief minister. But, Pawar has become a dependable ally for the BJP's Devendra Fadnavis by playing it better than Eknath Shinde, who went missing twice.

Around 223 years ago, Akal Takht ordered lashes for Maharaja Ranjit Singh for marrying a Muslim dancer from Heeramandi. This is what happened next.

Scientists recreate Santa Claus's real face after 1,700 yearsSaint Nicholas, a Christian bishop known for his generosity and gift-giving, lived during the early centuries of Christianity. His acts of kindness laid the foundation for the Dutch figure of Sinterklaas.

Meerut man gets death in Saudi Arabia over drugs, family says he was framedA Saudi court has sentenced a 35-year-old Indian national from Meerut, Uttar Pradesh, to death for alleged drug trafficking. Zaid Junaid was arrested in January 2023 after police found 700 grams of narcotics in his vehicle. Junaid's family claims he was framed and has appealed to the Indian government to intervene.

Champions Trophy 2025: Jay Shah to hold 1st meeting as ICC Chair todayThe newly elected chairman of the ICC (International Cricket Council) is likely to hold a meeting with all the board members on December 5. However, the Champions Trophy 2025 is not the priority of the meeting.

South Africa vs Sri Lanka 2nd Test livestreaming details: When and where to watchSouth Africa and Sri Lanka are all set to lock horns at St George's Park in Gqberha as both teams aim to secure a win. World Test Championship points will be at stake in the contest, which will be the series finale.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP.
